required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Somatometric Characteristics Between Cerebral Palsy and Normal Children, Cross-sectional, Multi Center Study
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Somatometric Characteristics Between Cerebral Palsy and Normal Children, Cross-sectional, Multi Center Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to: 1) secure basic data of patients with cerebral palsy, 2) seek ways to simplify the data for clinical application, 3) progress of hip dislocation, presence or absence of hip surgery, and The purpose of this study is to compare differences in body development according to severity and nutritional methods.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Measure the body length using a tape measure.(cm)

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: weight and height will be combined to report BMI in kg/m^2

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Measure the body circumference using a tape measure.(cm)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Use simple x-ray within 1 year prior to participation
secondary_outcome.description: It is measured by migration index, which measures the proportion of femoral heads not covered by acetabulum

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Use simple x-ray within 1 year prior to participation
secondary_outcome.description: The degree of scoliosis is measured by Cobbs angle

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year

arm_group.description: Children with stiff cerebral palsy, aged 1 to 13 years

study_pop.textblock: It is difficult to find the basis for calculation because there are no papers that measure the body size of children with cerebral palsy and papers that compare with normal children. In particular, children with cerebral palsy are rare diseases, and it is difficult to recruit a large number of subjects.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- aged 1 to 13
- Experiment group: Children with cerebral palsy, Control group: Normal children
- Patients who agreed to participate in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- do not agree with the study
- Those who find it difficult to participate under the judgment of the research director
